q: Google Inc. . Chief Executive Officer Eric Schmidt . Photographer: Tony Avelar/Bloomberg Eric Schmidt said he is`` committed to Google Inc. '' and that he agrees with co-founders Sergey Brin on`` everything.'' He said he will stay at Google Inc. as long as it is exciting. Eric Schmidt spoke to reporters in Munich today. Eric Schmidt , who will be replaced as CEO by Page on April 4, said the transition will not affect decision-making at the company.

BGC Partners analyst Colin Gillis said Google experienced tremendous growth under Eric Schmidt , becoming a search and advertising powerhouse, but the company also arguably experienced a number of missteps and missed opportunities. A case can also be made that the company has not built any new material revenue streams, was late to building for the mobile market, has no effective social solutions, overbuilt its headcount and placed itself in the crosshairs of government regulators, Gillis said. Danny Sullivan , editor-in-chief of technology blog SearchEngineLand.com, said Google's biggest challenges now are to`` prove that they've got their Mojo back and that nobody needs to fear them.''

deputy counsel to Ronald Reagan , announced the America's Ronald Reagan Committee to encourage a Pence-for-president bid. Mike Pence extraordinarily exemplifies the optimistic, pro-growth, pro-job creation Reagan-Kemp wing of the GOP. Kirsten Gillibrand has garnered positive attention recently for her roles in the repeal of the don't ask, don't tell law for gay troops and the passage of legislation to provide benefits to Sept. 11 responders. The poll found 52% of those surveyed saying they would re-elect Kirsten Gillibrand . She faces re-election in 2012.
